title: encentive: DevOps Engineer (w/m/d)
description:
Headquarters: Germany Hamburg


Unsere Mission
Bei encentive entwickeln wir flexOn ‚Äì ein intelligentes Energiemanagementsystem, das industrielle Anlagen mithilfe von KI steuert.
Wir sammeln Echtzeitdaten von Anlagen, prognostizieren deren Verhalten, kombinieren diese mit externen Faktoren wie Wetter und Energiepreisen und optimieren so gleichzeitig Kosten und CO‚ÇÇ-Emissionen.
Gestalte die Zukunft der Energie: Entscheidend wird nicht nur sein, weniger Energie zu verbrauchen, sondern diese zum richtigen Zeitpunkt einzusetzen ‚Äì so k√∂nnen volatile erneuerbare Energien aus Wind und Sonne optimal integriert werden.
Mit unserer KI-gest√ºtzten flexOn-Plattform helfen wir industriellen Stromverbrauchern, ihren Energieeinsatz aktiv zu flexibilisieren ‚Äì also Strom genau dann zu nutzen, wenn er besonders gr√ºn und kosteng√ºnstig ist.
Unser Ziel: die Dekarbonisierung des Energiesystems vorantreiben und gleichzeitig die Kosten unserer Kund:innen deutlich senken.
Heute ist flexOn ein Tool von Ingenieur:innen f√ºr Ingenieur:innen.
Morgen ‚Äì mit dir ‚Äì wird daraus ein Produkt, das Kund:innen begeistert, echten Mehrwert liefert und neue Standards in der Energiebranche setzt.
Deine Mission
Sorge f√ºr stabile Service Deployments und stelle sicher, dass unsere Systeme jederzeit zuverl√§ssig und performant laufen.
Unterst√ºtze unser Data Science Team bei MLOps-Prozessen, damit Machine-Learning-Modelle effizient, sicher und skalierbar in die Produktion gelangen.
Dokumentiere und erweitere unsere Cloud-Infrastruktur, um eine zukunftssichere Basis f√ºr Wachstum, Innovation und hohe Verf√ºgbarkeit zu schaffen.
Aufgaben
Automatisiere und professionalisiere Cloud-Resource-Deployments (z. B. mithilfe von Infrastructure-as-Code-Tools).
Baue unsere Kubernetes-Cluster weiter aus und stelle eine stabile, skalierbare Container-Infrastruktur sicher.
Plane und begleite Cloud-Migrationen in neue Umgebungen, um zukunftssichere Architekturen zu schaffen.
Strukturiere CI/CD-Pipelines neu, um Deployments effizienter, stabiler und sicherer zu gestalten.
Entwickle ein Datenbank-Migrationskonzept, das reibungslose √úberg√§nge und hohe Datenintegrit√§t gew√§hrleistet.
Qualifikation
Must-haves
3+ Jahre Erfahrung mit Kubernetes ‚Äì du beherrschst den Betrieb und Ausbau von Clustern.
Fundierte Erfahrung mit Terraform oder vergleichbaren Infrastructure-as-Code-Tools.
Erfahrung in AWS-Cloud-Umgebungen ‚Äì von Compute √ºber Storage bis hin zu Netzwerkservices.
Praxis im Umgang mit ArgoCD f√ºr GitOps-basierte Deployments.
Nice-to-haves
Erfahrung in der Softwareentwicklung mit Go (Golang) ‚Äì um auch tiefer in unsere Tool- und Service-Entwicklung einzusteigen.
Benefits
Echter Impact: Du leistest ab Tag eins einen sp√ºrbaren Beitrag im Kampf gegen den Klimawandel.
Unternehmerischer Freiraum: Flache Hierarchien, maximale Verantwortung und Gestaltungsfreiheit ‚Äì deine Ideen sind nicht nur willkommen, sondern entscheidend f√ºr die Weiterentwicklung von encentive.
Modernes Arbeitsumfeld: Inspirierende B√ºros im Herzen von Berlin-Mitte und in der Hamburger Sternschanze ‚Äì zentral gelegen, bestens angebunden und voller Leben.
Flexibilit√§t: Hybrides Arbeiten & flexible Arbeitszeiten ‚Äì du entscheidest, wie du deine Produktivit√§t am besten entfaltest.
Nachhaltige Mobilit√§t: Wir √ºbernehmen dein Deutschlandticket, damit du bequem und klimafreundlich unterwegs bist.
Gesundheit & Wohlbefinden: Zugang zu Wellpass mit hunderten Fitness- und Wellness-Angeboten deutschlandweit.
Teamgeist: Mehrere Offsites pro Jahr an spannenden europ√§ischen Locations ‚Äì f√ºr Inspiration, Strategie und echten Teamzusammenhalt.
Lern- & Entwicklungskultur: Wir unterst√ºtzen dich durch Mentoring, Weiterbildungen und den Zugang zu einem starken Gr√ºnder- und Investorennetzwerk.
Deine Chance
Wenn du die Zukunft der Energiebranche mitgestalten und ein Produkt auf das n√§chste Level bringen m√∂chtest, freuen wir uns auf deine Bewerbung.
Bewirb dich jetzt bei encentive ‚Äì und werde unsere:r neue:r DevOps Engineer (w/m/d).
Bei encentive sind Diversit√§t, Chancengleichheit und Inklusion keine Schlagworte, sondern gelebte Praxis. Wir freuen uns √ºber Bewerbungen von Menschen aller Geschlechter, Altersgruppen, Hintergr√ºnde, Religionen, sexuellen Orientierungen und Identit√§ten sowie von Menschen mit Behinderungen.
To apply: https://weworkremotely.com/remote-jobs/encentive-devops-engineer-w-m-d

title: Boldr: Technical Support Advocate (Web App/SaaS)
description:
Headquarters: South Africa
    
URL: http://boldrimpact.com


Description

A LITTLE BIT ABOUT Boldr

 
Boldr is the first global B-Corp dedicated to delivering world-class Client experiences while creating access to dignified, meaningful work in communities around the world.
 We are a global team, united by our desire to connect diverse people with common values for boldr impact.¬†
 We employ just over a thousand team members across five countries and we want to employ over 5,000 people by 2027, if not sooner.
 

LET‚ÄôS START WITH OUR VALUES

 
Meaningful connections start with AUTHENTICITY
 We do our best work by being CURIOUS
 We grow by remaining DYNAMIC
 Our success combines AMBITIOUS VISION with OPERATIONAL EXCELLENCE¬†
 At the heart of great partnerships we‚Äôll always find EMPATHY
 

WHAT IS YOUR ROLE

As a Technical Support Specialist, you will be on the frontlines of Gamma‚Äôs customer support operations. Your role is to ensure that users feel supported, empowered, and confident while navigating Gamma‚Äôs platform. You‚Äôll provide timely assistance through chat and email using Intercom, troubleshoot technical issues, and guide customers to make the most out of Gamma‚Äôs innovative tools.



WHY DO WE WANT YOU

We are currently looking for impact-driven individuals who are passionate in helping Boldr grow and achieve our Purpose. We expect our Team to become our ultimate partners to success by always giving their 110% in everything, sharing their talents and quirks, and championing our core values: Curious, Dynamic and Authentic.

WHAT WILL YOU DO
 
Respond to customer inquiries via chat and email support channels using the Intercom platform.
 Provide technical troubleshooting by diagnosing and resolving users issues related to presentations, website building, account management, and platform functionality.
 Guide users through Gamma‚Äôs features, including AI content generation, template customization, publishing, and collaboration tools.
 Provide accurate, timely solutions with a professional and empathetic tone.
 Log customer interactions, track recurring issues, and contribute to knowledge base improvements.
 Escalate complex technical issues to tier 2 support or development teams
 Educate users on platform capabilities and best practices for creating presentations and websites
 Maintain high standards of response time, accuracy, and customer satisfaction.
 
WHAT WE‚ÄôLL LIKE ABOUT YOU

¬†YOU ARE‚Ä¶


Curious and authentic, just like us! #beboldr¬†

 An analytical and critical thinker, with an eye for even the most minute of details
 Passionate about client satisfaction
 

YOU HAVE‚Ä¶

 
2 years of SaaS customer or technical support experience, preferably in technology or saas environments
 Familiarity with help desk or ticketing systems (Intercom experience a plus).
 Familiarity with website-building tools, content management systems, or presentation software¬†
 Strong technical aptitude for troubleshooting digital platforms and web-based apps.
 Excellent written communication skills with the ability to explain technical concepts clearly.¬†
 Comfortable navigating multiple software applications simultaneously.
 Strong collaboration and verbal communication skills for internal teamwork.
 Patience, empathy, and active listening skills to understand customer needs.
 Organization and efficiency in time management and an ability to juggle many ongoing initiatives with grace.
 Strong organizational and time management skills with the ability to juggle multiple projects.
 Proficiency for data analysis and process/operations improvement.
 Detail-oriented with a proactive approach to problem-solving.
 Ability to work collaboratively within a team and adapt to changing project requirements.
 

NICE TO HAVE‚Ä¶

 
Experience supporting creative professionals, small businesses, or startups.
 Knowledge of presentation software (Gamma, PowerPoint, Google Slides, Canva).
 Familiarity with AI-powered tools or generative platforms.
 

To apply: https://weworkremotely.com/remote-jobs/boldr-technical-support-advocate-web-app-saas

title: SixGen, Inc.: Senior Web Application Penetration Tester
description:
Headquarters: Remote
    
URL: http://sixgen.io



SIXGEN‚Äôs mission is to deliver agile, mission-ready cybersecurity solutions that empower government and critical infrastructure organizations to stay ahead of advanced cyber threats. We combine innovation, deep expertise, and cutting-edge capabilities to uncover vulnerabilities, protect vital systems, and ensure operational superiority in an ever-evolving digital landscape.
POSITION OVERVIEW
Position: Senior Web Application Penetration Tester
Job Type: Full Time
Location: Remote US. Proximity to Maryland or Virginia is a plus, but not required
Clearance Requirements:¬†Ability to obtain a Secret Clearance
Travel: Up to 10%
ABOUT THE TEAM
SIXGEN supports cyber and intelligence missions by serving government and commercial organizations as they overcome global cybersecurity challenges. You‚Äôll work with our highly skilled operators conducting research and assessments based on real-world threats. You‚Äôll simulate adversaries and malicious actors and report details and actionable findings on critical assets and infrastructures. Using innovative processes, tools, and techniques, you‚Äôll predict and overcome cybersecurity vulnerabilities. Your successes will be supported by our diverse team of experienced, technical talent.¬†
WHAT YOU'LL DO
Conduct comprehensive, black-box penetration testing of web applications to identify critical vulnerabilities such as SQL injection, XSS, CSRF, XXE, deserialization attacks, RCE, etc. Utilize a bug bounty-style approach to independently enumerate and assess targets, simulating real-world attack scenarios.
Analyze application architecture and source code (when available) to uncover deeper, logic-based or systemic vulnerabilities.
Document and communicate findings with clear risk assessments, reproduction steps, and actionable remediation recommendations.
Stay up to date with evolving web technologies, threat trends, and security tools to ensure cutting-edge testing practices.
REQUIRED QUALIFICATIONS
US Citizen with the ability to obtain a Secret clearance.
Minimum 5 years of hands-on web application penetration testing experience, with a strong preference for OSCP or equivalent hands-on certifications (e.g. CBBH, CWEE, OSWA, OSWE, GWAPT).
Proven ability to conduct full-scope penetration tests using tools like Burp Suite, Kali Linux, Metasploit, Nuclei, Nessus, and Nmap.
Experience developing actionable intelligence based on open source intelligence (OSINT) gathering.
Experience building offensive capabilities or tools to enhance operations with programming languages such as, but not limited to, Python, Bash, terraform, ansible, etc.
Experience in testing web-based APIs (i.e. REST, SOAP, XML, JSON).
Advanced knowledge of manual testing techniques and automated tools (e.g., Burp Suite, OWASP ZAP) to assess application security.
Familiarity with FISMA and NIST 800-series frameworks; experienced in applying formal testing protocols and methodologies to assess networks, web apps, and cloud environments.
Strong communication skills for interfacing with clients and documenting findings
Demonstrated experience working both collaboratively and independently with minimal supervision.
Awarded CVEs, Cloud, and Active Directory penetration testing is a plus but not required.
COMPENSATION & BENEFITS
Salary Range: $100,000 - $145,000 USD
The salary range for this role is an estimate based on a wide range of compensation factors, inclusive of base salary only. Actual salary offer may vary based on (but not limited to) work experience, education and/or training, critical skills, and/or business considerations. The final salary offer will be determined after a thorough review of the candidate's background and alignment with the role.
Additionally, SIXGEN offers top-tier benefits for full-time employees, including:
Employer-paid health insurance premiums (medical, dental, vision) for you and your family¬†
Employer-paid short/long term disability insurance and basic life/AD&D insurance
401K with a 4% employer contribution
Professional development reimbursement options available (training, certification, education, etc)‚Äã
Flexible and remote work policies for most positions
Flexible PTO and holiday schedule
OUR COMMITMENT
SIXGEN is an Equal Opportunity Employer. We ensure that all applicants are considered for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, age, marital status, ancestry, projected veteran status, or any other protected group or class.
We are committed to fostering an inclusive culture that values diversity in our people, reflecting the communities we serve and our customer base. We strive to attract and retain a diverse talent pool and create an environment where everyone is empowered to be their authentic selves at work.

To apply: https://weworkremotely.com/remote-jobs/sixgen-inc-senior-web-application-penetration-tester

title: leadtech: Technology Lead - web app - Leadtech (NodeJs, Typescript, AWS)
description:
Headquarters: Spain
    
URL: http://leadtech.com


Description

We're looking for an experienced Technology Leader/Engineering Manager (senior level) to join our team and help us deliver exceptional Web Experiences for our innovative, industry-leading products.
If you're a highly motivated person with a real interest in tech and a passion for building cutting-edge products, we've got the perfect job for you!
A little bit about us:
Leadtech has fostered and developed innovative digital businesses across various industries since 2009. We've now got a team of over 800 dedicated employees working around the world. We're really proud to have more than 23 nationalities working together, and we love that millions of users around the globe enjoy our products and services every month. #LifeAtLeadtech

What will you do?

Management of delivery, people, quality, and processes for one of our web products
Collaborate closely with the Product team to align the development roadmap of new products and iterations of existing products
Define and implement software development best practices (such as CI/CD, automated testing, code reviews, security) across all projects under your responsibility
Define and track a set of metrics to evaluate the health of applications, monitoring performance, stability, and software quality
Assess the technical feasibility of new projects and features, providing high-level estimates and recommendations
Enhancing the importance of team unity so that everyone feels part of the project and the company


Your team:
We‚Äôre team-first. If you believe in the power of collaboration and that the team‚Äôs success is your success, then you‚Äôre one of us!
Fun is fundamental. We believe in forming strong bonds in and outside the office. That‚Äôs why we have a team-building budget and organize activities to enjoy ourselves.
Positivity wins the day. Bring a positive attitude and communicate openly. Self-awareness and an openness to learn are always a plus.


Requirements
How will you make a difference?

You have proven leadership (more than 4 years) of Backend, Frontend, DevOps and QA teams, ensuring that they are aligned with the product/business and work towards a common goal
You have previous experience (more than 4 years) in BE/FE Web development (Typescript, NodeJs, React)
You have experience in working in websites with suites of cloud computing services such as AWS or GCP
You have previous experience managing people, delivery, quality and processes
You know how to implement software development best practices
You like to work in high pace and dynamic environments

You are an expert in promoting teamwork so that teams collaborate with each other and create synergies for continuous improvement
You have great communication and leadership skills
You are fluent in English and advanced level of Spanish (optional)

Benefits
WHY SHOULD YOU JOIN US?
Growth and career development

At Leadtech, we prioritize your growth. Enjoy a flexible career path with personalized internal training and an annual budget for external learning opportunities.

Work-Life balance

Benefit from a flexible schedule with flextime (7 - 9:30 a.m. start, 3:30 - 6 p.m. end) and the option of working full remote or from our Barcelona office. Enjoy free Friday afternoons with a 7-hour workday, plus a 35-hour workweek in July and August so you can savor summer!

Comprehensive benefits
 
Competitive salary, full-time permanent contract, and top-tier private health insurance (including dental and psychological services).
 25 days of vacation plus your birthday off, with flexible vacation options‚Äîno blackout days!
 
Unique Perks
 
If you wish to come, in our office in Barcelona you‚Äôll find it complete with free coffee, fresh fruit, snacks, a game room, and a rooftop terrace with stunning Mediterranean views.
 Additional benefits include ticket restaurant and nursery vouchers, paid directly from your gross salary.
 
Join us in an environment where you‚Äôre free to innovate, learn, and grow alongside passionate professionals. At Leadtech, you‚Äôll tackle exciting challenges and be part of a vibrant team dedicated to delivering exceptional user experiences

Sounds good? Apply now! We‚Äôre looking forward to getting to know you.

Equal Employment Opportunity Employer:
Leadtech is an Equal Employment Opportunity (EEO) Employer, which means we encourage applications from people with different backgrounds, interests, and personal circumstances. Our team welcomes applicants regardless of their race, gender, age, religion, nationality, sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expressi√≥n and/or disabilities. All we need is your high energy, skills, and willingness to be a part of a great project!

Location
You'll have the flexibility to choose whether you'd like to come to the office every day, from time to time, or work fully remote. We want you to find the best combination for you.
If you prefer to be surrounded with amazing people, our exceptional office is in Barcelona‚Äôs Blue Building, located right on the city's seafront. Besides our stunning views, you‚Äôll enjoy our office perks such as free fruit, snacks, and coffee and you‚Äôll also be able to take part in our Mario Kart and table tennis competitions.
The personal data you provide will be processed in order to manage your candidacy for the corporate selection processes that fit your profile. If you wish, you can exercise your rights of access, rectification or cancellation by writing to our address (Avenida Litoral, 12-14, 5ta planta. Barcelona. 08005) or to the email address protecciondedatos@LeadTech.com, attaching to your request a document that can validate your identity.

To apply: https://weworkremotely.com/remote-jobs/leadtech-technology-lead-web-app-leadtech-nodejs-typescript-aws

title: Urban Insight: SysAdmin with Drupal Experience - Part Time
description:
Headquarters: Remote
    
URL: http://urbaninsight.com



Who We Are
Urban Insight is a leading digital agency creating innovative websites and web applications for organizations that make a difference. We specialize in solving complex problems through website and web app strategy, design and development using open-source content management systems (primarily, Drupal and WordPress, and headless or composable architectures). Our clients include some of the most well-known museums, nonprofits, universities, cities, and other institutions. Urban Insight has been in business for 25 years and continues to expand each year. We thrive on having a professionally rewarding environment where team members are encouraged to grow.
¬†
The Opportunity
We are seeking a skilled, detail-oriented SysAdmin. The right individual will have a passion for efficiency, problem-solving, and collaboration. In this role at Urban Insight, you will manage all aspects of our systems, software, and developer operations. You will be instrumental in ensuring the stability, security, and optimal performance of our website development systems, tools, and processes. The ideal candidate will have experience as an IT generalist, and be able to provide guidance and technical support across the company. This position reports to the Director of Infrastructure and will collaborate closely with the Development Department and the entire Urban Insight team.
¬†
Key Responsibilities

Manage hardware, software, and account access; and provide technical support and troubleshooting across our fully remote, distributed team.

Be the face of technology for all new hires for onboarding and handle all offboarding activities.¬†

Manage the security and reliability of our websites (primarily, Drupal and Wordpress), systems, and internal infrastructure.

Collaborate with developers to ensure consistent and efficient work. Make sure they follow best practices, use the right tools, and maintain a strong working relationship.

Develop and maintain technical documentation, technical policies & procedures; and foster a culture of strong documentation.

Manage and perform hosting setup and configuration, security upgrades, and site launches for client projects.
¬†

Qualifications

5+ years proven experience as a Systems Administrator or similar role.

Hands-on experience with open-source CMS frameworks such as Drupal & WordPress.

Strong knowledge of system and network administration, including proficiency in Linux/Unix and MacOS environments.

Experience with cloud platform setup and maintenance (e.g., AWS, Azure, Google Cloud).

Familiarity with web development technologies and tools (e.g. Lando, Docker, Composer).

Solid understanding of security best practices and the ability to implement and monitor them effectively.

Excellent problem-solving and communication skills.

Ability to work well in a collaborative team environment.

Relevant certifications (e.g. AWS Certified SysOps, LPIC-1, CISSP) are a plus.
¬†

About Urban Insight

Urban Insight is a leading digital agency with 35+ team members. https://www.urbaninsight.com/ ¬†¬†

We work with some of the best-known museums, nonprofits and other institutions, such as LACMA, The Broad, University of Southern California, City of Los Angeles, and the Japanese American National Museum.

We‚Äôve won numerous design awards including such as for our work for Stay Housed Los Angeles and the National World War 1 Museum & Memorial.

We‚Äôre the top-ranked Web development agency in Los Angeles, according to Clutch, an independent analyst. Have a look at what our clients say about us: https://clutch.co/profile/urban-insight¬†

We have a clearly defined project management methodology and case management system.

We run on the Entrepreneurial Operating System.
¬†

Why Work at Urban Insight?

We take on interesting, meaningful projects for appreciative clients.

We offer a flexible working environment - work from anywhere in the United States.

We work with you to create a career path that works for you.

The average employee tenure is 6.5 years.

We're stable and growing. We've been in business for 23+ years and continue to grow each year.

We offer a casual and flexible working environment with plenty of opportunities for growth for the right candidate.

We believe in a reasonable life/work balance and enjoy 40-hour work weeks.

We allocate resources and time for training and professional development.

We have weekly events to keep the team connected: Lunch & Learns, Lightning Demos, Game Breaks.

There are many more reasons: https://www.urbaninsight.com/careers¬†


Compensation
We offer a highly competitive salary, which depends on your qualifications and experience. Our salary package includes:

Rate: $30-45/hr depending upon experience.

Approx Schedule: 18 hours per week

Performance and compensation reviews annually.

 

To apply: https://weworkremotely.com/remote-jobs/urban-insight-sysadmin-with-drupal-experience-part-time

title: Shippo: Engineering Manager, Web App (Remote)
description:
Headquarters: United States
    
URL: http://goshippo.com




Here at Shippo, we are the shipping layer of the internet and we consider ourselves to be one of the core building blocks of e-commerce. Our mission is to make merchants successful through world class shipping. With our products and solutions, we level the playing field by providing our customers with best-in-class solutions that otherwise wouldn‚Äôt be available to them. Through Shippo e-commerce businesses, marketplaces, platforms and a variety of logistics infrastructure providers are able to connect to shipping carriers around the world from one API and dashboard. We provide our customers with the most competitive shipping rates, print labels, automated international documents, shipment tracking, facilitate the returns process and more.


How we‚Äôll deliver success:


As an Engineering Manager for one of Shippo‚Äôs web application teams, you‚Äôll lead a cross-functional group of backend, frontend, and fullstack engineers. Your team owns our Order Management system ‚Äî the foundation that powers merchants‚Äô ability to manage, fulfill, and track their orders ‚Äî and contributes to product-led UX initiatives that improve the end-to-end shipping experience.


You‚Äôll play a critical role in defining technical direction, driving execution, and growing engineers while partnering closely with Product, Design, and other engineering teams.


Shipping & handling responsibilities:

Lead, mentor, and grow a diverse team of backend, frontend, and fullstack engineers
Set direction for the Order Management domain ‚Äî ensuring scalability, reliability, and maintainability
Own UX and Webapp core experience improvements that increase merchant success and operational efficiency
Partner cross-functionally with Product and Design to define roadmaps, deliver high-impact features, and iterate quickly
Foster a culture of ownership, accountability, and continuous improvement through compassionate candor and clear feedback
Champion engineering excellence: reliability, performance, observability, and automation across services and web applications
Own SLAs/SLOs for key Order Management APIs and workflows, driving adoption of best practices across dependent systems
Lead incident response and root cause analysis with a focus on learning and prevention
Contribute to the technical roadmap, balancing product innovation with system health and technical debt reduction



Requirements

3+ years of experience managing software engineering teams, including hiring, performance, and career development
9+ years of overall software engineering experience with a track record of delivering complex, scalable systems
Strong backend technical foundation (Python, Go, Java, or Ruby) and familiarity with modern frameworks (e.g., Django, FastAPI)
Proven experience designing, integrating, and maintaining APIs (REST, gRPC, SOAP)
Strong communication skills, with the ability to influence across teams and disciplines
Deep customer empathy and a focus on delivering measurable value to merchants
Experience leading teams through both technical execution and organizational change



Bonus

Familiarity with React.js and modern JavaScript frameworks
Experience with SQL and NoSQL databases (e.g., DynamoDB)
Exposure to event-driven architectures and queue systems (e.g., Redis, Kafka, NSQ)
Experience managing external vendor integrations and partner APIs



$175,000 - $238,000 a year

Our Compensation Shippolicy:
We believe compensation is a custom experience and are commited to fair and equitable compensation practices. The standard base pay range for this role is min is $175k to a max $238k annual salary. Since we are focused on hiring Shippos Everywhere, we have 2 US pay ranges, a standard compensation range for the majority of the US and a standard +1 compensation range for those who live in areas where the cost of labor is higher, such as NYC and California.
The actual base pay is dependent upon many factors, such as: financial budgets, work experience, training, transferable skills, business needs, and market value. The base pay salary ranges are subject to change and may be modified in the future. Total compensation for this role will include, equity, medical, dental, vision and other benefits noted in our Shippos ‚Äúpackage‚Äù section.


Sail through the process:
Here at Shippo, we celebrate inclusivity and are committed to creating equal access to opportunities for people from all backgrounds, perspectives and geographies. These values define who we are and everything we do. All qualified individuals are encouraged to apply. If you need assistance, or a reasonable accommodation during the application and recruiting process, please contact us at accommodations@goshippo.com


Shippos in the wild:
Our people, much like the packages we help ship, are all over the world. This means, through our remote-first program, ‚ÄúShippos Everywhere‚Äù, our roles can be based anywhere in the US with the exception of Delaware, Nevada, Ohio, Oregon, Hawaii, New Mexico and West Virginia and many roles can be based internationally.
For locations outside of the US and Ireland, the employment contracts are powered by Remote.com (all Shippo perks still apply - including equity!). What we want to emphasize is that you can be successful at Shippo regardless of location.


We leverage AI to review all resumes during the application phase to ensure fairness, comprehensively evaluate each submission, and mitigate bias. However, all decisions at every stage of the process are made by a real person.

We may use artificial intelligence (AI) tools to support parts of the hiring process, such as reviewing applications, analyzing resumes, or assessing responses. These tools assist our recruitment team but do not replace human judgment. Final hiring decisions are ultimately made by humans. If you would like more information about how your data is processed, please contact us.



To apply: https://weworkremotely.com/remote-jobs/shippo-engineering-manager-web-app-remote

title: FS Studio: Wordpress Web Developer
description:
Headquarters: Argentina
    
URL: http://fsstudio.com


Web Developer (WordPress / Design Implementation)
Location: Remote
Type: Contract
FS Studio is looking for a talented Web Developer to join our team to bring our new website vision to life. We‚Äôve designed our site in Framer and now need someone with both strong WordPress development skills and a sharp design eye to translate it into a polished, production-ready site.
Responsibilities

Translate the completed Framer design into a fully functional WordPress site, ensuring fidelity to the original layout, typography, and interactions.

Apply refinements and polish to the site‚Äîspacing, alignment, responsiveness, and micro-interactions‚Äîto elevate the overall design quality.

Implement mobile-first responsive design across devices and browsers.

Optimize the site for performance, accessibility, and SEO best practices.

Integrate required plugins, forms, and CMS features while maintaining a clean, maintainable codebase.

Collaborate with the FS Studio team to finalize details and provide input on UI/UX improvements.

Qualifications

Proven experience building and customizing WordPress websites from provided designs (portfolio required).

Strong proficiency in HTML5, CSS3, JavaScript, and PHP.

Experience with WordPress theme customization and plugin integration.

Keen design sensibility: ability to match and enhance design details, not just replicate them.

Solid understanding of responsive design, accessibility standards, and cross-browser compatibility.

Familiarity with SEO optimization and website performance best practices.

Bonus: experience working with Framer designs or similar design-to-development workflows.

What We‚Äôre Looking For
This role is perfect for someone who thrives at the intersection of development and design‚Äîyou‚Äôre not just a coder, but someone who cares about the craft of making a site look and feel exceptional.
To apply: https://weworkremotely.com/remote-jobs/fs-studio-wordpress-web-developer

title: Jobgether: Web Developer (Remote)
description:
Headquarters: United States
    
URL: http://jobgether.com


Description
This position is posted by Jobgether on behalf of a partner company. We are currently looking for a Web Developer (Remote) in the United States.
As a Web Developer, you will have the opportunity to design, build, and maintain interactive, high-quality web applications that support a variety of projects and initiatives. Working remotely, you will collaborate with cross-functional teams to implement responsive designs, integrate back-end data sources, and deliver user-friendly digital solutions. This role emphasizes creative problem-solving, iterative development, and staying current with the latest web technologies and best practices. You will contribute to impactful projects while growing your technical skills in a supportive and flexible environment.
 
Accountabilities

Collaborate with project teams to plan, design, and develop web applications that meet functional and technical requirements.
Create wireframes, mockups, and prototypes to visualize application features and user interfaces.
Build cross-browser compatible front-end applications using HTML5, CSS3, TypeScript, and related frameworks.
Access and integrate data from various back-end services and databases.
Participate in quality initiatives to maintain high standards of software performance and reliability.
Research, recommend, and implement new tools, technologies, and development methodologies.

 
Requirements

Bachelor‚Äôs degree in Computer Science or related field (or equivalent experience).
Minimum 1 year of experience developing and maintaining interactive web applications.
Proficiency in HTML5, CSS3, TypeScript/JavaScript, and web development frameworks (e.g., npm, jQuery, Bootstrap).
Experience with responsive design, UI/UX prototyping, and wireframing tools.
Familiarity with object-oriented programming languages such as C# or Java.
Strong problem-solving skills, adaptability, and a willingness to learn new technologies.
Excellent verbal and written communication skills.
Ability to work independently and collaboratively in remote and team-based settings.
Preferred: experience with SCSS/SASS and knowledge of RESTful web services.
Legal authorization to work in the United States without future sponsorship requirements.

 
Benefits

Competitive salary range ($88,000 - $99,000) with merit-based increases and bonus opportunities.
Flexible remote work environment to support work-life balance.
Comprehensive insurance options including health, dental, life, and short- and long-term disability.
Paid time off and parental leave programs.
Retirement savings options such as a 401(k) plan.
Professional development opportunities including education reimbursement and training programs.
Inclusive and collaborative company culture focused on innovation and personal growth.
